| Image                   = Dinosaur-People (Earth-616) from Venom Vol 1 151 001.jpg
| Name                    = Dinosaur-People
| Aliases                 = 

| Leaders                 = [[Julia Fontana (Earth-616)|Tana]]; formerly [[Vincent Stegron (Earth-616)|Stegron]]
| CurrentMembers          = [[Togar (Earth-616)|Togar]]

| Identity                = Public
| Affiliation             =

| Enemies                 = [[Sergei Kravinoff (Earth-616)|Kraven the Hunter]], [[Wilson Fisk (Earth-616)|Mayor Fisk]], [[New York City Police Department (Earth-616)|NYPD]], [[Frances Barrison (Earth-616)|Shriek]]

| Origin                  = [[Homo sapiens|Human]] employees of [[Alchemax (Earth-616)|Alchemax]] and numerous homeless people [[Glossary:Mutate|mutated]] by [[Vincent Stegron (Earth-616)|Stegron]] into [[Human-Dinosaur Hybrids|Human/Dinosaur Hybrids]]
| Reality                 = Earth-616
| Status                  = Active
| BaseOfOperations        = New York City Sewer System, [[Manhattan]], [[New York City|New York]], [[New York (State)|New York]], [[United States of America|USA]]
| PlaceOfFormation        = 
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 

| Creators                = 
| First                   = Venom Vol 1 151

| History                 = Alchemax proposed a project to use the [[Connors Formula|Lizard Formula]] to engineer a healing factor for soldiers, but as [[Curtis Connors (Earth-616)|Dr. Connors]] whereabouts were unknown they acquired custody of [[Vincent Stegron (Earth-616)|Stegron]], who had somehow been unpetrified following his battle with [[Karl Lykos (Earth-616)|Sauron]],{{r|Spider-Man and the X-Men Vol 1 2}} was taken into custody by the F.B.I. Stegron initially agreed to assist them, but later stole $10 million in equipment and escaped with a number of test subjects and employees, who he mutated into human-dinosaur hybrids under his control.{{r|Venom Vol 1 151}} Establishing a lair in the network of sewers and tunnels under New York, Stegron began abducting and mutating homeless people and animals, intending to conquer Manhattan by pouring gallons of his dinosaur serum into New York's water supply. However, Stegron was stopped by [[Edward Brock (Earth-616)|Venom]] and [[Lunella Lafayette (Earth-616)|Moon Girl]], and the dinosaur-people were freed from his control.{{r|Venom Vol 1 153}}

Revering Venom as their savior, the dinosaur-people swore to live peacefully below-ground and adopted a hunter-gatherer model of society. Some time later, the dinosaur-people came into conflict with the [[Moloids]], but Venom was able to prevent war from breaking out between the two subterranean communities and broker a truce.{{r|Venom Vol 1 155}} Hoping to expedite research into a cure for those who wished to return to being human, Eddie Brock published an article about the community in the [[Fact Channel News (Earth-616)|Fact Sheet]] tabloid, but that only drew the attention of [[Sergei Kravinoff (Earth-616)|Kraven the Hunter]].{{r|Venom Vol 1 156}} Alerting the NYPD and populace of New York to the dinosaur-peoples' presence to stir up a panic and instigate a man-hunt,{{r|Venom Vol 1 157}} Kraven attempted to carry out a genocide against them but was stopped by Venom. Falling under the leadership of [[Julia Fontana (Earth-616)|Tana]], a pterosaur-hybrid, the dinosaur-people resolved to retreat deeper into the tunnels to further distance themselves from the surface world and live by the example set by the Moloids.{{r|Venom Vol 1 158}}
| Equipment               = 
| Transportation          = 
| Weapons                 = Having adopted a Palaeolithic way of life, the dinosaur-people wield spears, knives, and other simple weaponry. Most, however, rely on their fangs, claws, and other natural weaponry.
